instruction: Design a simple financial budget plan.
output:
Here's a simple budget plan as a starting point:

1. Income:
   - Salary: $XXXX per month
   - Other Income: $XXX per month

2. Expenses:
   - Rent/Mortgage: $XXXX per month
   - Utilities (electricity, gas, water, internet): $XXX per month
   - Groceries: $XXX per month
   - Transportation (fuel, public transport): $XXX per month
   - Health (Insurance, fitness): $XXX per month
   - Entertainment (Eating out, movies, hobbies): $XXX per month
   - Clothes: $XXX per month
   - Personal Hygiene: $XXX per month

3. Savings & Investments:
   - Emergency Savings Fund: $XXX per month
   - Retirement contributions (401k, IRA): $XXX per month
   - Investment fund (stocks, bonds, real estate): $XXX per month

Consider tracking your income and expenses for a few months to understand where your money is really going and fine-tune your budget accordingly. Remember to review and adjust the budget regularly based on your current financial situation, goals and lifestyle.

instruction: Develop a basic home workout routine.
output:
Here's a simple home workout routine that targets the whole body:

- Warm-Up: 5 minutes of light jogging on the spot or brisk walking around the house.
- Push Ups: 3 sets of 10 reps. This primarily targets chest and triceps.
- Squats: 3 sets of 15 reps. This workout targets your legs and glutes.
- Planks: Hold yourself in a plank position for 30 seconds. Rest, then repeat for 4 times. This exercise is great for your core.
- Jumping Jacks: Do this for 1 minute. This is an excellent cardio exercise.
- Lunges: 3 sets of 10 reps per leg. This targets your legs and glutes.
- Mountain Climber: 3 sets of 15 reps. This is another great core exercise that also helps to increase your heart rate.
- Cool down: 5 minutes of light stretching to cool down and prevent injury.

Remember, the key to fitness is consistency, so try and stick to this routine at least 3-4 times a week.

instruction: Assist in creating a suitable daily schedule for improved productivity.
output:
Daily Schedule:
- 6:00 - 7:00 AM: Morning workout
- 7:00 - 7:30 AM: Morning routine (shower, get dressed)
- 7:30 - 8:00 AM: Have a nutritious breakfast
- 8:00 - 8:30 AM: Plan the day (prioritize tasks, settle down to work)
- 8:30 - 10:00 AM: Deep work (Focus without interruption on your most important tasks)
- 10:00 - 10:15 AM: Short break (Walk, stretch, meditate)
- 10:15 - 12:00 PM: Continue deep work 
- 12:00 - 1:00 PM: Lunch break 
- 1:00 - 3:00 PM: Continue deep work (The aim is to complete all the high-priority work by now)
- 3:00 - 3:15 PM: Short break 
- 3:15 - 5:00 PM: Lower-intensity work (administrative work, meetings, email, etc.)
- 5:00 - 5:30 PM: Review the day's work, plan for the next day and wrap up work
- 5:30 - 7:00 PM: Free time (Go for a walk, read, watch a show, spend time with loved ones, etc.)
- 7:00 - 8:00 PM: Dinner 
- 8:00 - 9:00 PM: Wind-down activities (quiet reading, soft music, relaxation exercises)
- 9:00 - 10:00 PM: Prepare for bed and sleep. 

This is a suggested schedule, and it is important to adjust it according to your needs, lifestyle, work hours, and energy levels through the day.

instruction: Recommend books according to the genre of interest.
output:
- Fiction: "To Kill A Mockingbird" by Harper Lee, "1984" by George Orwell, "The Great Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald
- Mystery: "Gone Girl" by Gillian Flynn, "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" by Stieg Larsson, "The Da Vinci Code" by Dan Brown
- Romance: "Pride and Prejudice" by Jane Austen, "Outlander" by Diana Gabaldon, "Fifty Shades of Grey" by E. L. James
- Science Fiction: "Dune" by Frank Herbert, "Ender's Game" by Orson Scott Card, "The Hunger Games" by Suzanne Collins
- Fantasy: "Harry Potter" series by J.K. Rowling, "Lord of the Rings" trilogy by J.R.R. Tolkien, "Game of Thrones" series by George R.R. Martin
- Historical Fiction: "The Book Thief" by Markus Zusak, "All The Light We Cannot See" by Anthony Doerr, "The Tattooist of Auschwitz" by Heather Morris
- Poetry: "Milk and Honey" by Rupi Kaur, "The Sun and Her Flowers" by Rupi Kaur, "A Beautiful Composition of Broken" by r.h. Sin
- Autobiography: "The Diary of a Young Girl" by Anne Frank, "Long Walk to Freedom" by Nelson Mandela, "I Am Malala: The Story of the Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Was Shot by the Taliban" by Malala Yousafzai.

instruction: Provide tips on how to improve sleep habits.
output:
- Follow a regular sleep schedule. Go to bed and wake up at the same time each day, even on the weekends. 
- Create a restful environment. Keep your room dark, quiet, and cool, and use your bed only for sleeping and sex.
- Exercise regularly. Regular physical activity, especially aerobic exercise, can help you fall asleep faster and make your sleep more restful.
- Limit daytime naps. If you need to nap, try to limit it to about 30 minutes and make sure it's during the mid-afternoon. 
- Manage stress and anxiety. Try relaxation techniques, such as deep breathing, yoga, or meditation, to help you fall asleep.

instruction: Design an efficient home cleaning schedule divided by daily, weekly, and monthly tasks.
output:
Daily Tasks:
- Make the bed 
- Wipe down the kitchen counters 
- Sweep the floors 
- Clean dishes after each meal 
- Wipe down bathroom surfaces

Weekly Tasks:
- Vacuum carpets and furniture 
- Mop the floors 
- Clean the bathroom tub and shower 
- Wipe down appliances in the kitchen 
- Dust furniture and shelves 
- Wash bedding and towels 
- Clean mirrors and windows 

Monthly Tasks:
- Deep-clean the bathroom and kitchen 
- Vacuum vents and woodwork 
- Clean light fixtures and ceiling fans 
- Wash windows 
- Clean inside of the refrigerator 
- Wipe down walls and baseboards.

instruction: Research and present three different travel options (flight, accommodation, meals) based on the provided travel dates and destination.
output:
Dates: Mar 1 - Mar 10 
Destination: Tokyo, Japan 
Option 1: 
- Flight: Japan Airlines, Mar 1 from LAX to HND, returning Mar 10. Economy class - $600
- Accommodation: Hotel Ryumeikan Ochanomizu Honten, Superior double room with breakfast included - $200/night
- Meals: Sukiyabashi Jiro, famous sushi restaurant, about $300/meal
Option 2: 
- Flight: ANA Airlines, Mar 1 from LAX to HND, returning Mar 10. Economy class - $650
- Accommodation: Hotel Gracery Shinjuku, Standard double room - $150/night, 
  Breakfast: Turret Coffee, local coffee shop, about $15 for coffee and pastries
- Meals: Yakiniku Jumbo Shirokane, Grilled meats, about $50/meal
Option 3: 
- Flight: Hawaiian Airlines, Mar 1 from LAX to HND, returning Mar 10. Economy class - $580
- Accommodation: Nine Hours Shinjuku-North, Capsule hotel - $50/night
- Meals: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles, Michelin-starred ramen, about $20/meal.

instruction: Prepare a budget projection for the coming month after the user provides their monthly income, projected expenses, savings, and investments.
output:
Assuming that the monthly income is $4000, projected expenses are $2500, savings are $500, and investments are $700, the budget projection for the coming month would be:

Income: $4000
- Expenses: $2500 
- Savings: $500
- Investments: $700
______________________
Available Balance: $300

Please note that these are hypothetical figures. Your exact budget projection will depend on your personal income and expense details.

instruction: Create a 30-day workout plan including cardio, strength, and flexibility exercises.
output:
Day 1: Cardio - Running for 30 minutes, Strength - Push-ups (3 sets of 12), Flexibility - Hamstring stretches
Day 2: Cardio - Jumping jacks (3 sets of 15), Strength - Squats (3 sets of 15), Flexibility - Forward bend
Day 3: Rest 
Day 4: Cardio - Swimming for 45 minutes, Strength - Bench press (3 sets of 10), Flexibility - Torso stretches
Day 5: Cardio - Bicycling for 30 minutes, Strength - Lunges (3 sets of 15), Flexibility - Butterfly stretch
Day 6: Rest 
Day 7: Cardio - Walking briskly for 30 minutes, Strength - Shoulder press (3 sets of 12), Flexibility - Back stretches
Day 8: Cardio - Stair climbing for 20 minutes, Strength - Dumbbell curls (3 sets of 12), Flexibility - Neck stretches
Day 9: Rest
Day 10: Cardio - Rowing for 30 minutes, Strength - Triceps dips (3 sets of 12), Flexibility - Glute stretches
Day 11: Cardio - High knees (3 sets of 15), Strength - Planks (3 sets of 30 seconds), Flexibility - Hip stretches
Day 12: Rest
Day 13: Cardio - Cycling for 30 minutes, Strength - Deadlifts (3 sets of 10), Flexibility - Arm and shoulder stretches
Day 14: Cardio - Jumping rope for 20 minutes, Strength - Pull-ups (3 sets of 10), Flexibility - Chest stretches
Day 15: Rest
Day 16: Cardio - Running for 30 minutes, Strength - Squats (3 sets of 20), Flexibility - Forward bend
Day 17: Cardio - Jumping jacks for 20 minutes, Strength - Push-ups (3 sets of 20), Flexibility - Back stretches
Day 18: Rest
Day 19: Cardio - Swimming for 30 minutes, Strength - Pull-ups (3 sets of 10), Flexibility - Butterfly stretch
Day 20: Cardio - Walking briskly for 30 minutes, Strength - Bench press (3 sets of 12), Flexibility - Torso stretches
Day 21: Rest
Day 22: Cardio - Bicycling for 30 minutes, Strength - Lunges (3 sets of 20), Flexibility - Glute stretches
Day 23: Cardio - Stair climbing for 20 minutes, Strength - Deadlifts (3 sets of 15), Flexibility - Hip stretches
Day 24: Rest
Day 25: Cardio - Rowing for 30 minutes, Strength - Push-ups (3 sets of 20), Flexibility - Chest stretches
Day 26: Cardio - High knees for 20 minutes, Strength - Planks (3 sets of 1 minute), Flexibility - Neck stretches
Day 27: Rest
Day 28: Cardio - Cycling for 30 minutes, Strength - Squats (3 sets of 25), Flexibility - Hamstring stretches
Day 29: Cardio - Jumping rope for 20 minutes, Strength - Triceps dips (3 sets of 15), Flexibility - Arm and shoulder stretches
Day 30: Rest

instruction: Assist in planning a surprise birthday party including venue selection, theme selection, guest list, food, and entertainment.
output:
Themes: 
- Superhero Party: this is suitable for comic book or superhero movies fans.
- Tropical Luau: for those who have a passion for the beach or love Hawaiian culture.
- Casino Night: for adults who enjoy games of chance and a little excitement.
- 80’s Retro: for those who find nostalgia in the 80’s era, featuring neon colors, arcade games, and disco balls.

Guest List: The guest list will depend on venue size and the birthday person's personal and professional relationships.

Food: Consider the dietary needs and preferences of the guests when selecting the food.

instruction: Provide tutoring or educational resources in a specified subject area.
output:
Subject Area: Calculus
Resources:
1. Khan Academy (https://www.khanacademy.org/) - Offers practice exercises, instructional videos, and a personalized learning dashboard that allow learners to study at their own speed in and outside of the classroom.
2. MIT OpenCourseWare (https://ocw.mit.edu/) - Provides lecture notes, exams, and videos without any required registration.
3. Coursera (https://www.coursera.org) - Offers courses, certificates, and degrees online from world-class universities and companies.

Subject Area: Physics
Resources:
1. Physics Classroom (https://www.physicsclassroom.com/) - Provides a variety of free educational resources including tutorials, practice problems, simulations, and lab activities.
2: Hyperphysics (http://hyperphysics.phy-astr.gsu.edu/) - An exploration environment for physical concepts and theories, providing graphics, animations, and links to detailed explanations for each topic.
3. Khan Academy - Physics (https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics) - Offers in-depth coverage of high school and college level physics.

Subject Area: Chemistry
Resources:
1. Khan Academy - Chemistry (https://www.khanacademy.org/science/chemistry) - Offers a comprehensive course on Chemistry including videos and quizzes.
2. CHEMguide (http://www.chemguide.co.uk/) - This is an excellent resource for understanding the basics of chemistry, from understanding atoms to chemical reactions.
3. LearnChemistry (http://www.rsc.org/learn-chemistry) - By Royal Society of Chemistry, provides comprehensive resources on various chemistry topics. 

Subject Area: Programming
Resources:
1. Codecademy (https://www.codecademy.com/) - Interactive platform that teaches you how to code in multiple programming languages.
2. Coursera (https://www.coursera.org/courses?query=programming) - Offers programming courses from universities and companies.
3. LeetCode (https://leetcode.com) - Excellent website to sharpen your programming and problem-solving skills by practicing with programming challenges.
